content.question: Is the student’s claim correct? Why or why not?

choices.label: Yes, because the potential difference across the resistor is equal to <math alttext="open E" overflow="scroll"><mi>Ɛ</mi></math> even if the voltmeter is nonideal
Yes, because the ammeter will measure the current in the battery
No, because the nonideal voltmeter will cause the potential difference across the resistor to change
No, because the finite resistance of the nonideal voltmeter will change the equivalent resistance of the circuit

content.answer: No, because the finite resistance of the nonideal voltmeter will change the equivalent resistance of the circuit

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
